intro: Sphaeralcea fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and open woodlands. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant has a compact, bushy growth habit. Sphaeralcea fasciculata is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
